Get a pointer to the base transform for a specified sub motion.

Parameters

Motion - The Motion that contains the sub motion to be queried.

SubMotionIndex - The index of the desired sub motion.

Returns

If the passed Motion is a compound motion and the indexed sub motion exists, the return value is a const pointer to the sub motion's base transform. If any error occurs, the return value is NULL.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_SetBaseTransform( geMotion *M,int SubMotionIndex, geXForm3d *BaseTransform );

Description

Set a sub motion's base transform.

Parameters

Motion - The compound Motion that contains the sub motion.

SubMotionIndex - Index of the sub motion whose time offset is to be set.

BaseTransform - The sub motion's new base transform. Pass NULL to clear any existing base transform.

Returns

If the Motion is a compound motion and the sub motion exists, the return value is GE_TRUE. The function will return GE_FALSE if the Motion is not a compound motion.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

The function will fail if the indexed sub motion does not exist.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_GetTransform(const geMotion *M, geFloat Time, geXForm3d *Transform);

Description

Obtain a compound motion's blended base transform.

Parameters

Motion - The compound Motion to query.

Time - The time at which to query the compound motion.

Transform - Pointer to a transform that is filled in with the blended base transform.

Returns

If successful, the function returns GE_TRUE the Transform pointed to is filled with the blended base transform. On error, or if the motion is not a compound motion, the function returns GE_FALSE and the Transform is not modified.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

Each sub motion has an optional base transform. This function provides a way to blend the base transforms of the sub motions in a compound motion.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_GetTimeExtents(const geMotion *M,geFloat *StartTime,geFloat *EndTime);

Description

Gets the motion's starting and ending times. Gets time of first key and time of last key (as if motion did not loop)

// if there are no paths in the motion

Parameters

Motion - The Motion to query.

StartTime - Pointer to a floating point variable that will be filled with the time of the Motion's earliest key frame.

EndTime - Pointer to a floating point variable that will be filled with the time of the Motion's latest key frame.

Returns

If successful, the function returns GE_TRUE and the variables pointed to by the StartTime and EndTime parameters are filled with the Motion's earliest and latest key times, respectively. If any error occurs, the function returns GE_FALSE and the times are not set.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

If the Motion is a compound motion, StartTime and EndTime values are computed from the scaled sub motions.

No scaling is applied to simple (i.e. non-compound) Motions.

If the Motion has no events (i.e. no key frames in any path), the function returns GE_FALSE.

For a compound motion, GetTimeExtents will return the extents of the scaled submotions. For a single motion, no scaling is applied. Only one event is allowed per time key.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_InsertEvent(geMotion *M, geFloat tKey, const char* String);

Description

Insert an event into the Motion's event list. Inserts the new event and corresponding string.

Parameters

Motion - The Motion in which to insert the event.

Time - The event's time time key.

String - The event string to be associated with this time key.

Returns

If the event is successfully added, the function returns GE_TRUE. If any error occurs, the return value is GE_FALSE.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

Only one event is allowed at a given time. If you attempt to add an event at an existing time, the function returns GE_FALSE.

The function returns GE_FALSE if you attempt to add an event to a compound Motion.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_DeleteEvent(geMotion *M, geFloat tKey);

Description

Removes an event from the Motion's event list. Deletes the event

Parameters

Motion - The Motion from which to delete the event.

Path - The time key of the event to delete.

Returns

If the function finds and successfully deletes the event, the return value is GE_TRUE. If the event does not exist in the Motion, the function returns GE_FALSE.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

Events may not be added to or deleted from compound motions.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geMotion_SetupEventIterator(geMotion *M,geFloat StartTime, geFloat EndTime);

Description

Initialize the structures necessary to iterate over a motion's events.

For searching or querying the array for events between two times times are compaired [StartTime,EndTime), '[' is inclusive, ')' is non-inclusive. This prepares the geMotion_GetNextEvent() function.

Parameters

Motion - The Motion whose events are to be enumerated.

StartTime - First time for which events are to be returned.

EndTime - Ending iterator time.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function resets internal variables in the Motion so that its events can be enumerated by successive calls to geMotion_GetNextEvent. The first to geMotion_GetNextEvent will return the first event whose time is equal to or greater than StartTime. Subsequent calls to geMotion_GetNextEvent will return events up to but not including EndTime.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_GetNextEvent(geMotion *M, geFloat *pTime, const char **ppEventString);

Description

Get the event time and event string associated with the next event in the Motion. Iterates from StartTime to EndTime as setup in geMotion_SetupEventIterator() and for each event between these times [StartTime,EndTime) this function will return Time and EventString returned for that event and the iterator will be positioned for the next search. When there are no more events in the range, this function will return GE_FALSE (Time will be 0 and ppEventString will be empty).

Parameters

Motion - The Motion to query.

PTime - Pointer to a floating-point variable that will be filled with the next event's Time.

PpEventString - Pointer to a character string pointer that will reference the next event's event string. This is a pointer to const string data.

Returns

If successful, the function returns GE_TRUE and the variables pointed to by the pTime and ppEventString parameters are set. If an error occurs, the function returns GE_FALSE and the return variables are not modified. If the Motion has no more events, the function returns GE_FALSE, and the *pTime is set to 0.0f, and *ppEventString is set to NULL.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

A program must first call geMotion_SetEventIterator before calling this function. Iterates from StartTime to EndTime as set up in geMotion_SetEventIterator, and returns the Time and EventString for each event in the range beginning with StartTime up to but not including EndTime. After each call, the iterator is positioned for the next search.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_GetEventExtents(const geMotion *M, geFloat *FirstEventTime, geFloat *LastEventTime);

Description

Get the first and last events' starting times. Returns the time associated with the first and last events

Parameters

Motion - The Motion to query.

FirstEventTime - A pointer to a floating-point variable that will receive the time of the Motion's first event.

LastEventTime - A pointer to a floating-point variable that will receive the time of the Motion's last event.

Returns

The return value is GE_FALSE if the Motion has no events(and Times are not set). Otherwise the return value is GE_TRUE.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

If the Motion has no events, the FirstEventTime and LastEventTime variables are not set. If Motion has only one event, the first and last event times will be equal.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geMotion *GENESISCC geMotion_CreateFromFile(geVFile *f);

Description

Read a Motion from the specified file.

Parameters

F - An opened file positioned at the point from which path information is to be read. The file may contain binary- or text-format information.

Returns

If the function succeeds, the return value is a valid geMotion object. If the function fails, it returns NULL.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

When the function returns, the file will be positioned after the last byte read. The specified file may not be a directory.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_WriteToFile(const geMotion *M, geVFile *f);

Description

Write the Motion, in text format, to a file.

Parameters

Motion - The Motion to output.

F - A pointer to an open VFile object to which the Motion will be saved.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the output operation is successful. If any error occurs, GE_FALSE is returned.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

The file must be opened before calling this function.

This function is obsolete and should be used for backward compatibility only. Text format will be removed in a future version. Text format requires more space to store and more time to save and load than does binary format. New programs should use geMotion_WriteToBinaryFile.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geMotion_WriteToBinaryFile(const geMotion *M,geVFile *pFile);

Description

Write the Motion information, in binary format, to a file.

Parameters

Motion - The Motion to output.

F - A pointer to an open VFile object to which the Motion will be saved.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the output operation is successful. If any error occurs, GE_FALSE is returned.

Declared

Motion.h

Code

 

Remarks

The file must be opened before calling this function. This is the recommended method of writing a Motion to a file.

Example

 

 

gePath Functions

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC gePath_CreateRef( gePath *P );

Description

Increases the reference count of the specified path.

Parameters

Path - The path to which a reference should be created.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

See the Genesis3D Engine API Overview in the Eclipse documentation for more information on reference counting.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI gePath *GENESISCC gePath_Create(gePath_Interpolator TranslationInterpolation, gePath_Interpolator RotationInterpolation, geBoolean Looped);

Description

Creates a gePath object. .

Parameters

TranslationInterpolation -

GE_PATH_INTERPOLATE_LINEAR

Straight line interpolation.

GE_PATH_INTERPOLATE_HERMITE

Hermite cubic spline curve

GE_PATH_INTERPOLATE_HERMITE_ZERO_DERIV

Hermite cubic spline curve with zero derivative at

keyframes for 'easing' curves.

RotationInterpolation -

GE_PATH_INTERPOLATE_LINEAR

Straight line interpolation.

GE_PATH_INTERPOLATE_SLERP

Spherical-linear blend.

GE_PATH_INTERPOLATE_SQUAD

Higher order blend for 'G1' continuity.

Looped -

Set to GE_TRUE to create a looped motion.

Returns

If the function succeeds, the return value is a valid gePath object with no keyframes. If the function fails, it returns NULL.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

When creating a looping motion, the first and last keyframes in both channels should be identical. The path generator will choose arbitrarily between these two keyframes when sampling exactly at the end of the loop.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI gePath *GENESISCC gePath_CreateCopy( const gePath *P );

Description

Creates a copy of a gePath object.

Parameters

Path - The path to copy.

Returns

If the function succeeds, the return value is a valid gePath object that is an exact copy of the passed-in Path. If the function fails, it returns NULL.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

The returned Path is not a reference, but an entierly new Path object. To create a reference, call gePath_CreateRef.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC gePath_Destroy(gePath **PP);

Description

Destroys the path pointed to by the specified path pointer.

Parameters

PP - A pointer to the path to be destroyed.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

The reference count of the specified path is decreased. If the reference count goes to zero, then the path information is deallocated and the path pointer is set to NULL.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_InsertKeyframe(gePath *P, int ChannelMask, geFloat Time, const geXForm3d *Matrix);

Description

Inserts a keyframe into the specified channels.

Parameters

Path - The path in which to insert the keyframe.

ChannelMask - The channels in which to insert the keyframe. Can be a combination of -

GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL and

GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL.

Time - The keyframe's time.

Matrix - The matrix that contains the transformation for this keyframe.

Returns

If the keyframe is inserted successfully, the return value is GE_TRUE. If the function is unable to insert the keyframe in all of the specified channels, the return value is GE_FALSE and no keyframes are added to any channels.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

If GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL is specified, the rotation part of the passed matrix is stored as the keyframe transform for the rotation channel. If GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL is specified, the translation part of the passed matrix is stored as the keyframe transform for the translation channel. The function will fail if a keyframe already exists at the specified time.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_DeleteKeyframe(gePath *P, int Index, int ChannelMask);

Description

Deletes the indexed keyframe in the specified channels.

Parameters

Path - The path that contains the keyframe to be deleted.

Index - The index of the keyframe to be deleted.

ChannelMask - The channel or channels from which to delete the keyframe. This can be a combination of GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL and GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL.

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE if the specified keyframe is deleted from all specified channels. Returns GE_FALSE if any error occurs.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

The function will fail if the specified keyframe does not exist. If multiple channels are specified and the keyframe exists in one channel but not the other, the keyframe will be deleted from the channel that contains it, and the function will return GE_FALSE. Note that deleting a keyframe from multiple channels may produce unexpected results if the keyframes

were added to individual channels at different times by separate calls to gePath_InsertKeyframe.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_GetTimeExtents(const gePath *P, geFloat *StartTime, geFloat *EndTime);

Description

Obtains the time extents of the given path. (ignoring looping)

Parameters

Path - The path to be queried.

StartTime - A pointer to a variable that will be set to the path's first keyframe time.

EndTime - A pointer to a variable that will be set to the path's last keyframe time.

Returns

If the path has no keyframes, the return value is GE_FALSE, and the time extent variables are not changed. If the path contains one or more keyframes, the return value is GE_TRUE and the StartTime and EndTime variables are set..

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

If the path contains one or more keyframes, then the earliest keyframe time (from both channels) is placed in StartTime, and the latest keyframe time (again, from both channels) is placed in EndTime. On successful return, EndTime will always be greater than or equal to StartTime.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC gePath_GetKeyframe(const gePath *P, int Index, int Channel, geFloat *Time, geXForm3d *Matrix);

Description

Obtains the transform and the time of the indexed keyframe in a specified channel.

Parameters

Path - The path that contains the keyframe to be returned.

Index - The index of the keyframe to be returned.

Channel - The channel or channels from which to obtain the keyframe. This can be a combination of GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL and

GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL.

Time - A pointer to a variable in which the keyframe's time will be returned.

Matrix - A pointer to the variable in which to return the keyframe's transform.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

The function will fail if the specified keyframe does not exist in the channels specified. If multiple channels are specified, the keyframe must exist in both channels. If a channel is not specified, then the poirtion of the matrix corresponding to that channel will be set to identity.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI int GENESISCC gePath_GetKeyframeCount(const gePath *P,int Channel);

Description

Returns a count of the number of keyframes in the specified channel.

Parameters

Path - The path that contains the keyframes to be counted.

Channel - The channel to count. This may be

GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL or

GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL

Returns

The count of keyframes in the specified channel.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function will only return the count of keyframes in a single channel. If the channel parameter contains a mask, the return result is undefined.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI int GENESISCC gePath_GetKeyframeIndex(const gePath *P, int Channel, geFloat Time);

Description

Obtains the index of a keyframe at the specified time.

Parameters

Path - The path that contains the keyframe to be returned.

Channel - The channel from which to obtain the keyframe index. This can be GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL or GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL.

Time - The time index of the keyframe index to return.

Returns

If a keyframe exists at the specified time, the index of the keyframe is returned. If no keyframe exists in the specified channel at the specified time, the return value is -1.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

If the channel parameter contains a mask of more than one channel, the return value is undefined. The channel

must contain a keyframe at the exact time specified, or the function will return -1.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC gePath_Sample(const gePath *P, geFloat Time,geXForm3d *Matrix);

Description

Sample the path at the specified time to obtain the transform.

Parameters

Path - The path to sample.

Time - The time at which to sample the path.

Matrix - The matrix in which to return the transform for the current time.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

All channels are sampled using the individual channel interpolation types. The resulting components (rotation and translation) are combined and placed in the matrix. // p is not const because information is cached in p for next sample sampling a path (time based)

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC gePath_SampleChannels(const gePath *P, geFloat Time, geQuaternion *Rotation, geVec3d *Translation);

Description

Sample the path at the specified time to obtain the individual transform components.

Parameters

Path - The path to sample.

Time - The time at which to sample the path.

Rotation - The quaternion in which to return the rotation component.

Translation - The vector in which to return the translation component.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

All channels are sampled using the individual channel interpolation types. The resulting rotation component is returned as a quaternion, and the resulting translation is returned as a vector. P is not const because information is cached in P for next sample

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_OffsetTimes(gePath *P, int StartingIndex, int ChannelMask, geFloat TimeOffset );

Description

slides all samples in path starting with StartingIndex down by TimeOffset

Parameters

 

Returns

 

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function is not currently implemented.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_ModifyKeyframe(gePath *P,int Index,int ChannelMask, const geXForm3d *Matrix);

Description

Change the transformation for an existing keyframe.

Parameters

Path - The path that contains the keyframe to be modified.

Index - The index of the keyframe to be modified.

ChannelMask - The channels in which to insert the keyframe. Can be a combination of

GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL and

GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL.

Matrix - The matrix that contains the new transformation for this keyframe.

Returns

If the keyframe is modified successfully, the return value is GE_TRUE.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

If the specified keyframe index does not exist in one of the channels, the function will fail. If GE_PATH_ROTATION_CHANNEL is specified, the rotation part of the passed matrix is stored as the keyframe transform for the rotation channel. If GE_PATH_TRANSLATION_CHANNEL is specified, the translation part of the passed matrix is stored as the keyframe transform for the translation channel. Note that modifying a keyframe in multiple channels may produce unexpected results if the keyframes were added to individual channels at different times by separate calls to gePath_InsertKeyframe.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI gePath* GENESISCC gePath_CreateFromFile(geVFile *F);

Description

Reads information from the specified file and creates a Path.

Parameters

F - An opened file positioned at the point from which Path information is to

be read. The file may contain binary- or text-format information.

Returns

If the function succeeds, the return value is a valid gePath object. If the function fails, it returns NULL.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

When the function returns, the file will be positioned after the last byte read. The passed-in file may not be a directory.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_WriteToFile(const gePath *P, geVFile *F);

Description

Write the path information, in text format, to a file.

Parameters

Path - The path to output.

F - A pointer to an open VFile object to which the path information will be

saved.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the output operation is successful. If any error occurs, GE_FALSE is returned.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

The file must be opened before calling this function. All path information is output to the file.

This function is obsolete and should be used for backward compatibility only. Text format will be removed in a future version. Text format requires more space to store and more time to save and load than does binary format. New programs should use gePath_WriteToBinaryFile.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC gePath_WriteToBinaryFile(const gePath *P, geVFile *F);

Description

Write the path information, in binary format, to a file. Dumps a minimal binary image for fastest reading

Parameters

Path - The path to output.

F - A pointer to an open VFile object to which the path information will be

saved.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the output operation is successful. If any error occurs, GE_FALSE is returned.

Declared

Path.h

Code

 

Remarks

The file must be opened before calling this function. All path information is output to the file. This is the recommended method of writing path information to a file.

Example

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE otherwise.

geQuaternion Functions

Function

geBoolean GENESISCC geQuaternion_IsValid( const geQuaternion *Q );

Description

Determines if the quaternion is valid. This is a debugging API, primarily. It was designed to test for quaternions that contained NAN values on Intel machines, since it is easy to let NAN values slip into calculations. Since NANs do not generate hardware exceptions, it can be exceedingly difficult to determine when data has gone bad.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to test

Returns

return GE_TRUE if Q is non null and for has no NAN's in its components

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_Set( geQuaternion *Q, geFloat W, geFloat X, geFloat Y, geFloat Z);

Description

set quaternion components. Doesn't normalize. Builds a quaternion from discrete components.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to build

W - W component

X - X component

Y - Y component

Z - Z component

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

Does not normalize the resulting quaternion.

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_SetVec3d( geQuaternion *Q, geFloat W, const geVec3d *V);

Description

set quaternion components. Doesn't normalize. Builds a quaternion from a W component, and a vector.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to build

W - W component of the quaternion

V - X, Y and Z components of the quaternion

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

This does not normalize the resulting quaternion.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geQuaternion_SetFromAxisAngle( geQuaternion *Q, const geVec3d *Axis, geFloat Theta);

Description

Builds a quaternion from an axis and a rotation about that axis.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to build

Axis - Axis vector

Theta - Rotation angle about Axis, in radians

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

geBoolean GENESISCC geQuaternion_GetAxisAngle(const geQuaternion *Q, geVec3d *Axis, geFloat *Theta);

Description

Calculates an axis and a rotation angle about that axis from a quaternion.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to convert

Axis - Vector to receive the axis result

Theta - Resulting rotation angle in radians

Returns

returns GE_TRUE if there is an axis. returns GE_FALSE if there is no axis (and Axis is set to 0,0,0, and Theta is 0)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_Get( const geQuaternion *Q, geFloat *W, geFloat *X, geFloat *Y, geFloat *Z);

Description

Extracts the discrete elements of a quaternion.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to extract elements of

W - Variable to place W component in

X - Variable to place X component in

Y - Variable to place Y component in

Z - Variable to place Z component in

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_GetVec3d( const geQuaternion *Q, geFloat *W, geVec3d *V);

Description

Gets the quaternion components into a scalar float, and a vector.

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to extract from

W - Receives W component of Q

Vector - Receives X, Y and Z components of Q

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_FromMatrix(const geXForm3d *RotationMatrix, geQuaternion *QDest);

Description

Takes upper 3 by 3 portion of matrix (rotation sub matrix) and generates a quaternion. Builds a quaternion from a rotation transform.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to convert

Qdest - Quaternion to conver to

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geQuaternion_ToMatrix(const geQuaternion *Q, geXForm3d *RotationMatrixDest);

Description

Builds a rotation transform from a quaternion. Takes a unit quaternion and makes RotationMatrixDest an equivelant rotation xform. (any translation in RotationMatrixDest will be list)

Parameters

Q - Unit quaternion

RotationMatrixDest - Transform to receive rotational equivalent of Q

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

Any translation in XForm is lost. This function does not work correctly on non-unit quaternions.

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_Slerp(const geQuaternion *Q0,const geQuaternion *Q1, geFloat T,geQuaternion *QT);

Description

Calculates a spherical interpolation between two quaternions. Spherical interpolation between q0 and q1. 0<=t<=1 resulting quaternion is 'between' q0 and q1 with t==0 being all q0, and t==1 being all q1.

Parameters

Q0 - Start quaternion

Q1 - End quaternion

T - Percentage (value from 0 through 1) between Q0 and Q1 that we need to end up at.

QT - Interpolated result

Returns

Nothing (void).

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

Returns a quaternion with a positive W, always taking the shortest route through the positive W domain.

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_SlerpNotShortest(const geQuaternion *Q0, const geQuaternion *Q1, geFloat T, geQuaternion *QT);

Description

Calculates a spherical interpolation between two quaternions. Spherical interpolation between q0 and q1. 0<=t<=1 resulting quaternion is 'between' q0 and q1 with t==0 being all q0, and t==1 being all q1.

Parameters

Q0 - Start quaternion

Q1 - End quaternion

T - Percentage (value from 0 through 1) between Q0 and Q1 that we need to end up at.

QT - Interpolated result

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function is the same as Quaternion_Slerp, except that we do not ensure that the resulting path is not the shortest one. Hence W can be either sign in the result.

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_Multiply(const geQuaternion *Q1, const geQuaternion *Q2, geQuaternion *QProduct);

Description

multiplies q1 * q2, and places the result in q. // no failure. renormalization not automatic

Parameters

Q1 - Input Quaternion

Q2 - Input Quaternion

Qproduct - Result of Q1 * Q2

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

Result is not necessarily normalized.

Example

 

 

Function

Vector - Vector to rotate

Vrotated - Resulting rotated vector

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

QExp - Result

Returns

Code

 

Remarks

This operation only works on pure quaternions - those in which the scalar portion is zero. (zero scalar part (W))

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_Scale(const geQuaternion *Q,geFloat Scale, geQuaternion *QScaled);

Description

Scales a quaternion. Q = Q * Scale (result is not generally a unit quaternion!)

Parameters

Q - Quaternion to scale

Scale - Scale value

Qscaled - Result of Q * Scale

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

Result is not generally a unit quaternion.

Example

Parameters

Q2 - Input Quaternion

Qsum - Q1 + Q2

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

QSum = Q1 + Q2 (result is not generally a unit quaternion!)

Subtracts two quaternions.

Parameters

Q1 - Input quaternion

Q2 - Input quaternion

QSum - Result of Q2 - Q1

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

QSum = Q1 - Q2 (result is not generally a unit quaternion!)

Example

Function

geBoolean GENESISCC geQuaternion_Compare( geQuaternion *Q1, geQuaternion *Q2, geFloat Tolerance );

Description

Compares two quaternions.

Parameters

Q1 - Input quaternion

Q2 - Input quaternion

Tolerance - Tolerance to compare within

Returns

GE_TRUE if all the corresponding elements of the quaternions compare within the supplied Tolerance,GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

void GENESISCC geQuaternion_SetMaximalAssertionMode( geBoolean Enable );

Description

Enables or disables strict constraint testing on transforms at runtime.

Parameters

Enable - GE_TRUE to enable strict checking, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Quatern.h

Code

 

Remarks

In debug builds, the quaternion library performs a number of tests on quaternions on many operations. The sum of these tests imposes a very significant performance penalty on the basic operation of the whole engine, which tends to make debug builds untenable in the development environment. Consequently, we have made the running of the most expensive of these tests conditional to the enabling of maximal assertions in the quaternion library, and defaulted to not doing these tests. If you are experiencing trouble with your quaternions becoming non-unit, or are having other difficult to track down problems with your quaternions, you may want to enable these tests. This API is not present in the release builds of the engine.

Example

 

 

geRam Functions

Function

GENESISAPI void *geRam_Allocate(uint32 size);

Description

Allocates memory.

Parameters

Size - Size, in bytes, of the block to allocate.

Returns

Pointer to the new memory block on success, NULL on failure.

Declared

Ram.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void geRam_Free_(void *ptr);

Description

Frees a block allocated with geRam_Allocate.

Parameters

Ptr - Block to free.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Ram.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void *geRam_Realloc(void *ptr,uint32 newsize);

Description

Resizes a block of memory. This function is equivalent to realloc.

Parameters

Ptr - Block to resize.

NewSize - New size of the block.

Returns

Pointer to new block of memory on success, NULL on failure.

Declared

Ram.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void geRam_ReportAllocations(void);

Description

Dumps a report on currently allocated blocks.

Parameters

Void

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Ram.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function will do a dump via OutputDebugString of all the blocks that are currently allocated, listing the file

name and line number of the source module from which the block was allocated. Blocks which have been corrupted in

sentinel areas reserved by geRam_Allocate will be flagged as such, and reported as well. This function is only operational in

debug builds.

Example

 

 

geSound Functions

Function

GENESISAPI geSound_System *geSound_CreateSoundSystem(HWND hWnd);

Description

Creates a SoundSystem to be used for playing sounds.

Parameters

HWnd - Window handle that sound system should receive focus from.

Returns

Return a geSound_System object on success, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

Windows.h must be included before genesis.h for this api to be exposed.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void geSound_DestroySoundSystem(geSound_System *Sound);

Description

Destroy a SoundSystem object

Parameters

*Sound - pointer to sound system object to destroy

Returns

Nothing

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geSound_Def *geSound_LoadSoundDef(geSound_System *SoundS, geVFile *File);

Description

Loads a .WAV file, to be later used to play.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to sound system to be used for the operation.

*File - pointer to name and path of sound file to load

Returns

Returns a geSound_Def object on success, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void geSound_FreeSoundDef(geSound_System *SoundS, geSound_Def *SoundDef);

Description

Frees a previously loaded SoundDef.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to SoundSystem that was used to load the sound def.

*SoundDef - pointer to SoundDef to free.

Returns

Nothing

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geSound *geSound_PlaySoundDef(geSound_System *SoundS, geSound_Def *SoundDef, geFloat Volume, geFloat Pan, geFloat Frequency, geBoolean Loop);

Description

Plays a SoundDef through the speakers of the currently active sound card.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to Sound system to use for the operation.

*SoundDef - pointer to SoundDef to use.

Volume - A value from 0.0 to 1.0.

Pan - A value from -1.0 to 1.0. -1.0 being left side, 0.0 being middle. 1.0 being right side.

Frequency - A value from 0.0 to 1.0. Amount of the original Freq to play at.

Loop - A geBoolean that specifies if the sound should Loop.

Returns

Returns a geSound object used to manipulate the sound after it has started playing on success. NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geSound_StopSound(geSound_System *SoundS, geSound *Sound);

Description

Stops a currently playing sound.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to SoundSystem that was used to play the sound.

*Sound - pointer to Sound to stop.

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geSound_ModifySound(geSound_System *SoundS, geSound *Sound, geFloat Volume, geFloat Pan, geFloat Frequency);

Description

Modifies a currently playing sound.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to SoundSystem used to play the sound.

*Sound - pointer to Sound to modify.

Volume - A value from 0.0 to 1.0.

Pan - A value from -1.0 to 1.0. -1.0 being left side, 0.0 being middle. 1.0 being right side.

Frequency - A value from 0.0 to 1.0. Amount of the original Freq to play at.

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geSound_SoundIsPlaying(geSound_System *SoundS, geSound *Sound);

Description

Returns if the Sound is playing or not.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to SoundSystem used to play the sound.

*Sound - pointer to Sound to check.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the sound is playing, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geSound_SetMasterVolume( geSound_System *SoundS, geFloat Volume );

Description

Sets the master volume of the SoundSystem.

Parameters

*SoundS - pointer to Sound system to change the master volume for.

Volume - A value from 0.0 to 1.0.

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

geSound3D Functions

Function

GENESISAPI void geSound3D_GetConfig(const geWorld *World, const geXForm3d *CameraTransform, const geVec3d *SoundPos, geFloat Min, geFloat Ds, geFloat *Volume, geFloat *Pan, geFloat *Frequency);

Description

Used to create a 3d sound configuration.

Parameters

*World - pointer to world to create 3d sound from.

*CameraXForm - pointer to location of the person that will hear the sound.

*SoundPos - Pointer to position of the sound.

Min - This is the minimum distance in world units at which the sound will always be at full volume.

Ds - This is the change in speed of the sound at this point in time. It is used to calculate the doppler shift.

*Volume - pointer to a variable that will be filled with the Volume.

*Pan - pointer to a variable that will be filled with the Pan value.

*Frequency - pointer to a variable that will be filled with the Frequency.

Returns

Nothing

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

geVec3d Functions

Function

GENESISAPI geFloat GENESISCC geVec3d_GetElement(geVec3d *V, int Index);

Description

Treats the input vector as an array, and returns the corresponding element's value.

Parameters

V - Input vector

Index - Element index where

0 Return value is V->X

1 Return value is V->X

2 Return value is V->X

Returns

Value of V->X, Y or Z, depending on ElementIndex.

Declared

Vec3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geVec3d_Set(geVec3d *V, geFloat X, geFloat Y, geFloat Z);

Description

Sets a vector from discrete components.

Parameters

V - Vector to be initialized

X - X value for the vector

Y - Y value for the vector

Z - Z value for the vector

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Vec3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVec3d_Compare(const geVec3d *V1, const geVec3d *V2,geFloat tolarance);

Description

Compares V1 to V2, applying the Tolerance value to the comparisons of each element. If each element pair

compares within the tolerance.

Parameters

V1 - Vector to be compared

V2 - Vector to be compared

Tolerance - Floating point tolerance to be applied to each pair of vector elements. Usually, this is a small number.

Returns

geBoolean - the return is GE_TRUE. Otherwise it is GE_FALSE

Declared

Vec3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

Returns

The length of the vector before normalization.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVec3d_IsValid(const geVec3d *V);

Description

Determines if the vector is valid. This is a debugging API, primarily. It was designed to test for vectors that contained NAN values on Intel machines, since it is easy to let NAN values slip into calculations. Since NANs do not

generate hardware exceptions, it can be exceedingly difficult to determine when data has gone bad.

Parameters

V - Vector to be tested.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the vector is valid, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vec3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

geBoolean geVFile_Disperse(geVFile *FS)

Description

This API to be documented and implemented in a later release.

Parameters

*FS - pointer to FileSystem

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

 

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geVFile_TimeToWin32FileTime(const geVFile_Time *, LPFILETIME Win32FileTime);

Description

Converts a geVFile time to a Win32 FILETIME structure.

Parameters

Time - geVFile time object

Win32FileTime - Win32 FILETIME object to convert to

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This API is the way to get the file time into a format to do standardized date/time operations on. We do not provide date/time operations natively.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geVFile_Finder * GENESISCC geVFile_CreateFinder(geVFile *FileSystem, const char * FileSpec);

Description

Creates a finder object from which you can get iterated file names.

This is findfirst/findnext functionality. Creates a finder object which can be iterated on to obtain file lists.

Parameters

FS - File system to be used for search operations.

FileSpec - File specification (may include * and ?) to match against

Returns

A valid geVFile_Finder object on success, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

Code

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_FinderGetProperties(const geVFile_Finder *Finder, geVFile_Properties *Properties);

Description

Gets the file properties from a geVFile_Finder. You cannot set properties for a file through a finder. You have to set the properties through a geVFile. Gets the properties of the current file that a finder points to.

Parameters

Finder - Finder to get properties from

Properties - Properties structure to fill with information about the file

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

You can only get properties through a finder. In order to set properties, you have to have a file handle, and set the properties through the geVFile itself.

Example

 

 

Function

geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_Startup(void);

Description

Initializes the VFile System. This API MUST be called before any other VFile APIs are called. This API ensures that the rest of the VFile systems will be thread safe. Hence the application should ensure that this function is called once and only once.

Parameters

None (void)

Returns

GE_TRUE if succeeded GE_FALSE otherwise

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geVFile * GENESISCC geVFile_OpenNewSystem(geVFile * FS, geVFile_TypeIdentifier FileSystemType, const char *Name, void *Context, unsigned int OpenModeFlags);

Description

Opens a file / file system. FileSystemType, // { DOS, MEMORY, ETC ... },

Parameters

FS -

File system to open the file in. This must be NULL if the

SystemType is GE_VFILE_TYPE_MEMORY. It can

optionally be NULL for all other FSAPI types currently.

SystemType -

Which registered file system API set (FSAPI) to use for

operations on the file. Currently, this can be one of:

GE_VFILE_TYPE_DOS

GE_VFILE_TYPE_MEMORY

GE_VFILE_TYPE_VIRTUAL

Name -

Name of the file to open. This must be NULL if the

SystemType is GE_VFILE_TYPE_MEMORY, or if the

SystemType is GE_VFILE_TYPE_VIRTUAL and FS is

not NULL.

Context -

Context information for some FSAPI kinds. Currently, this

can only be non-NULL for GE_VFILE_TYPE_MEMORY

SystemType, in which case, it must point to a

geVFile_MemoryContext structure.

The geVFile_MemoryContext structure can be filled out in

two ways. If the file is to be opened for readonly access,

then the Data field must point to valid memory, and the

DataLength field must be non-zero. If the file is to be opened

for creation, then both these fields must be NULL.

OpenFlags -

Valid combination of the GE_VFILE_OPEN flags. See the

overview for a detailed discussion of which flags are valid

under which circumstances.

Returns

A geVFile handle on success, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_UpdateContext( geVFile *FS, void *Context, int ContextSize);

Description

Update the context information of a geVFile object.

Parameters

Vfile - File to get context information from

Context - Context buffer to fill

ContextSize - Size of the context structure

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This API was provided to retrieve updates to the initial context information that a file system was created with from an arbitrary file system. It is a method for extending a file system API implementation so that additional information can be queried from any file system without having to add to the geVFile API. Currently, this function only applies to GE_VFILE_TYPE_MEMORY. In this case, it is helpful for the following case: If you create a GE_VFILE_TYPE_MEMORY object for write, and write a bunch of data to it, you do not have access to the memory

buffer that the file system is using, as you passed in NULL in the geVFile_MemoryContext. At any time, you can ask for an updated context from the memory file system, and this will give you access to the memory buffer. This allows you to write to a memory file, then retrieve the buffer pointer, and copy it. You must treat the pointer as const.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geVFile * GENESISCC geVFile_GetContext(const geVFile *File);

Description

Returns the outer context in which File was opened. Gets the outer geVFile from which this VFile was opened, if any exists.

Parameters

Vfile - File to get the context from

Returns

Returns the outer context in which File was opened, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

The only way that this function can return NULL is if the file was opened with geVFile_OpenNewSystem and no file system were passed in.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geVFile * GENESISCC geVFile_Open(geVFile * FS, const char * Name, unsigned int OpenModeFlags);

Description

Open a file

Parameters

FS - File system to open the file in

FileName - Name of the file to open (can have a relative directory)

OpenFlags - Valid combination of the GE_VFILE_OPEN flags

Returns

A geVFile handle on success, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This routine searches the search path, if any, in FS. The OpenFlags are subject to the runtime restrictions described in Genesis3D docs overview.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_AddPath(geVFile *FS1, const geVFile *FS2, geBoolean Append);

Description

Appends (or prepends) the path associated with FS2 into FS1. Adds a file system to the search path of another file system for open operations.

Parameters

FS1 - File system to add to

FS2 - New file system to be searching

Append - GE_TRUE means append FS2 to the search order, while GE_FALSE means prepend.

Returns

Append==GE_TRUE causes the FS2 to be searched AFTER FS1. Append==GE_FALSE causes the FS2 to be searched BEFORE FS1

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_DeleteFile(geVFile *FS, const char *FileName);

Description

Deletes a file from the given FileSystem.

Parameters

FileSystem - File system to delete the file from

FileName - Name of the file to delete

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_RenameFile(geVFile *FS, const char *FileName, const char *NewName);

Description

Renames a file within a file system.

Parameters

FS - File system to rename the file in

FileName - Name of the file to change

NewName - New name for the file

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This operation will always fail if the FS passed in does not have the attribute GE_VFILE_ATTRIB_DIRECTORY

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_FileExists(geVFile *FS, const char *FileName);

Description

Checks for file existence. Does not do any searching (?)

Parameters

FS - File system to check for existance of the file in

FileName - Name of file to look for.

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE if the file FileName exists in FS, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This operation will search the search path that FS makes up. If other file systems have been added to the search path, they will be tested as well.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_Close (geVFile *File);

Description

Closes a file and destroys the handle.

Parameters

VFile - File to be closed.

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

The operation can fail in several cases, most pertaining to running out of disk space. In the case of virtual file systems that are being constructed, the directory for the VFS is written to the parent file on the close operation for the VFS. If this write fails, the close operation will fail. There is no way to recover from this.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_GetS (geVFile *File, void *Buff, int MaxLen);

Description

Reads a string, including the carriage return, from a geVFile.

Parameters

Vfile - File to read from

Buff - Buffer to read to

MaxLen - Maximum number of bytes to read

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function is intended to work exactly as fgets does, except on geVFiles. The function will return GE_FALSE if the buffer length is exceeded.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_Read geVFile *File, void *Buff, int Count);

Description

Reads data from a file.

Parameters

Vfile - File to read from

Buffer - Buffer to read to

Count - Count of bytes to read

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This operation will work on any file whose attributes include GE_VFILE_ATTRIB_DIRECTORY.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_Write (geVFile *File, const void *Buff, int Count);

Description

Writes data to a file.

Parameters

Vfile - File to write to

Buffer - Data to write

Count - Count of bytes to write

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This operation always works on any file whose attributes include GE_VFILE_ATTRIB_DIRECTORY.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_Seek(geVFile *File, int where, geVFile_Whence Whence);

Description

Sets the file position.

Parameters

Vfile - File to seek in.

Where - Position to seek to, dependent on Whence parameter

Whence -

GE_VFILE_SEEKCUR

Where is relative to the current file pointer

GE_VFILE_SEEKEND

Where is relative to the end of the file

GE_VFILE_SEEKSET

Where is relative to the beginning of the file

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

Fails on any file whose attributes include GE_VFILE_ATTRIB_DIRECTORY.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geVFile_Printf(geVFile *File, const char *Format, ...);

Description

Prints to a file.

Parameters

Vfile - File to print to

Format - Format control string for the printf

... - Arguments to the control string

Returns

GE_TRUE if the operation succeeds, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Vfile.h

Code

 

Remarks

This function is currently limited to an 8K output buffer for each invocation. The Format string follows the standard rules for printf format strings. In fact, the implementation applies vsprintf to get the result.

Example

GE_TRUE if the file pointer is at the end of file, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Example

 

 

geWorld Functions

Function

geEntity_EntitySet geWorld_GetEntitySet(geWorld *World, const char *SetName)

Description

Retrieves a named set of entites from the world.

Parameters

World - World to get the set from

SetName - Name of the set to search for

Returns

A geEntity_EntitySet if one is found, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

Currently, the world has one entity set for each named type of entity that is included in the BSP file by the level designer. The name of the set is the name of the type used in the header file that the editor parses. See the overview for more information on entities.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geWorld *geWorld_Create(geVFile *File);

Description

Creates a geWorld object. When the world is first created, it will default to all the entity info, models, and other data that was created during the editing stage. You may add primitives to the world (Actors, Polys, Meshes) as you wish, and they will be rendered each time geEngine_RenderWorld is called.

Parameters

*File - pointer to geVfile of a .BSP file to read the world from.

If this parameter is NULL, an empty world is created with a constant size, containing a single empty space. The world then is essentially just a container that renders the subobjects.

If the File parameter is not NULL, then it must point to a BSP file, and a world is created from this. Geometry, texture information, lighting data, visibility data, entities, etc are all read and instantiated.

Returns

Returns a pointer to a geWorld object on success, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

The world must be added to a geEngine with geEngine_AddWorld before it can be rendered.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void geWorld_Free(geWorld *World);

Description

Destroys a world. Frees a previously loaded geWorld object. Any thing added or created with the world, will be destroyed when the world is destroyed. IOW, the geWorld object performs full garbage collection. However, you may free these items before freeing the world with no effect on the world.

Parameters

*World - pointer to a geWorld object to destroy.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

Destroys the world, and all it contains. This includes bitmaps, Actors, polygons, lights and fog objects. Note that this function differs from the Create/Destroy model discussed in the overview in the Genesis3D documentation. This will be changed before the final release of the engine.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_RemoveActor (geWorld *World, geActor *Actor);

Description

Removes an geActor from the world

Parameters

*World - pointer to the World

*Actor - pointer to the geActor to remove

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_AddActor (geWorld *World, geActor *Actor, uint32 Flags, uint32 UserFlags);

Description

Adds a geActor to the World

Parameters

*World - pointer to the World

*Actor - pointer to the geActor to add

Flags -

Any combination of the following:

Flag Meaning

GE_ACTOR_RENDER_NORMAL

Render in normal views

GE_ACTOR_RENDER_MIRRORS

Render in mirrors

GE_ACTOR_RENDER_ALWAYS

Render always

GE_ACTOR_COLLIDE

Consider the Actor for collision

in calls to geWorld_Collision.

UserFlags - Arbitrary flags reserved for the user

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_SetActorFlags (geWorld *World, geActor *Actor, uint32 Flags);

Description

Set the value of an Actor flag or flags.

Parameters

*World - pointer to the World

*Actor - pointer to the geActor to be modified

Flags -

Any combination of the following:

Flag Meaning

GE_ACTOR_RENDER_NORMAL

Render in normal views

GE_ACTOR_RENDER_MIRRORS

Render in mirrors

GE_ACTOR_RENDER_ALWAYS

Render always

GE_ACTOR_COLLIDE

Consider the Actor for collision

in calls to geWorld_Collision.

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_AddBitmap( geWorld *World, geBitmap *Bitmap);

Description

Adds a bitmap to the world.

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld to add the bitmap to

*Bitmap - pointer to geBitmap to add

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

Until a bitmap is added to the world, it may not be used to render user added polygons (geWorld_AddPoly). Bitmaps are added to the world implicitly when Actors are added to the world, and when a world is created with a BSP file which contains bitmaps.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_RemoveBitmap(geWorld *World, geBitmap *Bitmap);

Description

Removes a bitmap from the world.

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld to add the bitmap to

*Bitmap - pointer to geBitmap to remove

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

*Bitmap - pointer to geBitmap to check for

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBitmap *geWorld_GetBitmapByName(geWorld *World, const char *BitmapName);

Description

Retrieves a world texture by name.

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld to check for the bitmap

*Bitmap - pointer to geBitmap to retrieve

Returns

geBitmap object, if found, NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

This API only applies to bitmaps that were used to texture the world geometry in the editor. The name of the bitmap is the name that appears in the editor to the level designer. The API was provided as a means for the applications programmer to gain access to world bitmaps so as to run procedural algorithms on them.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_BitmapIsVisible(geWorld *World, const geBitmap *Bitmap);

Description

Tests to see if a bitmap was used in the previous frame for any rendered polygon.

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld to test the bitmap in

*Bitmap - pointer to geBitmap to test

Returns

GE_TRUE if the Bitmap was used in the previous frame, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

This API was added to allow clients to test a bitmap to see whether or not it is being rendered currently so that processing on the Bitmap may be foregone in the interests of efficiency. For example, if you are running procedural routines on a set of bitmaps, you may only which to run those procedurals if the bitmap is actually being rendered currently.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geWorld_Model *geWorld_GetNextModel(geWorld *World, geWorld_Model *Start);

Gets the next valid model in the world, from a current model. NOTE - The first model in the world is the parent model

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld object to search.

*Start - pointer to Model to start searching from. NULL will return the first one.

Returns

Pointer to Next available model. NULL if there is no more in the list.

Remarks

Function

GENESISAPI geLight *geWorld_AddLight(geWorld *World);

Description

Adds a dynamic light to the world. Currently there is a limitation of 32 Dynamic lights in the world.

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld object to add light to.

Returns

Returns a geLight object on success. Returns NULL if their are no more lights available. Note - The caller should try to ignore a NULL value, and proceed as normal if possible

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

This API differs from the container model outlined in the overview for technical reasons. It will be reviewed at a later date, and may be altered to conform.

Parameters

*Light - pointer to the geLight object

Radius - radius of the light

CastShadow - a boolean true to cast shadow, false otherwise

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE otherwise.

Remarks

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_TestModelMove( geWorld *World, geWorld_Model *Model, const geXForm3d *DXForm, const geVec3d *Mins, const geVec3d *Maxs, const geVec3d *In, geVec3d *Out);

Description

Tests if a Model can be moved to the designated coordinates.

Parameters

*World - pointer to the geWorld object

*Model - pointer to the geModel object to be moved

*DXForm - pointer to transform of the proposed move

*Mins - pointer to Minimum bounding box coordinates

*Maxs - pointer to Maximum bounding box coordinates

*In - pointer to geVec3d object

*Out - pointer to geVec3d object

Returns

GE_TRUE on success (can be moved without collision), GE_FALSE otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_Collision(geWorld *World, const geVec3d *Mins, const geVec3d *Maxs, const geVec3d *Front, const geVec3d *Back, uint32 Contents, uint32 CollideFlags, uint32 UserFlags, GE_CollisionCB *CollisionCB void *Context, GE_Collision *Col);

Description

Tells you of a collision with anything in the world, by a segment defined by a front, back and box. It currently collides with all: Models (Including world) Actors Meshes

Parameters

*World - World to do collision test against

Mins - Minimum values of an axial aligned bounding box to collide against the world. If this value is NULL, then the collision is considered a ray collision test. The bounding box dimensions are relative to the Front/Back vector, not in absolute world coordinates. If you provide a bounding box, the entire box is collided against the world.

Maxs - Maximum values of an axial aligned bounding box to collide against the world. If Mins are specified, then the Maxs must be specified as well.

Front - Start of the ray or box movement to test.

Back - End of the ray or box movement to test

Flags - Combination of:

Flag Meaning

GE_COLLIDE_MODELS

Do collision testing against all

models, including the world

GE_COLLIDE_ACTORS

Collide against Actors

GE_COLLIDE_NO_SUB_MODELS

Collide only against the world,

and ignore any submodels

UserFlags - Flags to mask against user flags in collideable objects, such as Actors. These flags are masked against the UserFlags on those objects, and the Collision test is made if the result is non-zero. Otherwise, the object is Ignored. This is a means of fast rejection for potential collideable sets, and for preventing collisions conditionally for arbitrary purposes.

CollisionCB - Callback function to be called for each object that we collide against. The callback function has the opportunity to accept or reject the collision. If the Collision is rejected, then the collision testing proceeds against the other Objects in the world, until a collision is accepted, or there are no more collisions. If this parameter is NULL, then the first object collided against is returned.

Context - Arbitrary context pointer which is passed to the CollisionCB function on each call.

Collision - Resulting collision information structure.

Returns

GE_TRUE if there was a collision. GE_FALSE if there was no collision.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

NOTE - Mins/Maxs CAN be NULL. If you are just testing a point, then use NULL (it's faster!!!).

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean geWorld_GetContents(geWorld *World, const geVec3d *Pos, const geVec3d *Mins, const geVec3d *Maxs, uint32 Flags, uint32 UserFlags, GE_CollisionCB *CollisionCB, void *Context, GE_Contents *Contents);

Description

the contents that an object is standing in. Gets content information about a position and bounding box from a world.

Parameters

*World - pointer to a valid geWorld object

*Position - pointer to position in the world to gather information about

*Mins - pointer to minimum values of an axial aligned bounding box. If this parameter is NULL, then the test is performed only on the single point of the Position parameter. If the bounding box is supplied, then the function can return multiple contents for the different regions of the bounding box.

*Maxs - pointer to maximum values of the axial aligned bounding box. If Mins is not NULL,then this parameter must not be NULL.

Flags - What to collide with. Currently: GE_COLLIDE_MODELS (Including world) GE_COLLIDE_ACTORS GE_COLLIDE_MESHES GE_COLLIDE_ALL

UserFlags - UserFlags to mask against objects in the volume of the bounding box/point.

*CollisionCB - pointer to collision callback function to be called for each object found in the bounding region.

*Context - pointer to geContext passed to the CollisionCB on each occurence of an object/space found in the bounding region.

*Contents - pointer to geContents structure that is filled in with information about the contents of the region if this function returns GE_TRUE.

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE if object occupied anything other than empty...

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI gePoly *geWorld_AddPolyOnce(geWorld *World, GE_LVertex *Verts, int32 NumVerts, geBitmap *Bitmap,gePoly_Type Type, uint32 RenderFlags, float Scale);

Description

Adds a polygon to the world for rendering.

Parameters

*World - pointer to World to add the polygon to

*Verts - pointer to an array of vertices, in clockwise order, that make up the polygon. The polygon will be ordered in the world for rendering based upon its geometric center. Note that while the vertices of the polygon have a field

for alpha level, only the first vertex's alpha value is considered when

rendering. This is because most cards do not support iterated alpha values.

NumVerts - Count of vertices in the vertex array. Must be at least 3, if Type is not GE_TEXTURED_POINT. If Type is GE_TEXTURED_POINT, then the

Count must be 1.

*Bitmap - pointer to geBitmap to texture the polygon with. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the polygon is rendered gouraud shaded.

Type - One of:

Type Meaning

GE_TEXTURED_POLY

The polygon is textured. The Bitmap

parameter must be a valid geBitmap.

GE_GOURAUD_POLY

The polygon is Gouraud shaded. The

Bitmap parameter must be NULL.

GE_TEXTURED_POINT

The Bitmap parameter must be a valid

geBitmap. The polygon is composed of a

single vertex, which is its center. When it is

rendered, a polygon which is the size of the

dimensions of the supplied bitmap is drawn

such that the plane of the polygon is

perpendicular to the camera used to render

the scene. The dimensions of the polygon

are scaled by the Scale parameter.

Paraphrased, this means that the polygon is

a 3d sprite.

RenderFlags -

Scale - Scaling value that is applied to the dimensions of the polygon if Type is GE_TEXTURED_POINT.

Returns

GE_TRUE on success, GE_FALSE on failure.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI gePoly *geWorld_AddPoly(geWorld *World, GE_LVertex *Verts, int32 NumVerts, geBitmap *Bitmap, gePoly_Type Type, uint32 RenderFlags, float Scale);

Description

Adds a poly to the world to render in the next RenderWorld frame call. the poly is rendered until it is removed.

Parameters

*World - pointer to geWorld to add poly to.

*Verts - pointer to GE_LVertex to use for rendering which is an array of vertices, in clockwise order, that make up the polygon. The polygon will be ordered in the world for rendering based upon its geometric center. Note that while the vertices of the polygon have a field for alpha level, only the first vertex's alpha value is considered when rendering. This is because most cards do not support iterated alpha value.

NumVerts - Count of vertices in the vertex array. Must be at least 3, if Type is not GE_TEXTURED_POINT. If Type is GE_TEXTURED_POINT, then the Count must be 1..

*Bitmap - Pointer to Texture to use for rendering. Bitmap to texture the polygon with. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the polygon is rendered gouraud shaded.

Type - Type of rendering. Currently valid types are: GE_TEXTURED_POLY, GE_GOURAUD_POLY, GE_TEXTURED_POINT

Type Meaning

GE_TEXTURED_POLY

The polygon is textured. The Bitmap

parameter must be a valid geBitmap.

GE_GOURAUD_POLY

The polygon is Gouraud shaded. The

Bitmap parameter must be NULL.

GE_TEXTURED_POINT

The Bitmap parameter must be a valid

geBitmap. The polygon is composed of a

single vertex, which is its center. When it is

rendered, a polygon which is the size of the

dimensions of the supplied bitmap is drawn

such that the plane of the polygon is

perpendicular to the camera used to render

the scene. The dimensions of the polygon

are scaled by the Scale parameter.

Paraphrased, this means that the polygon is

a 3d sprite.

RenderFlags Special Effects Flags

Scale - Scaling value that is applied to the dimensions of the polygon if Type is GE_TEXTURED_POINT.

Returns

Returns a gePoly structure on success. Returns NULL otherwise.

Declared

Genesis.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void geWorld_RemovePoly(geWorld *World, gePoly *Poly);

Description

Removes a previously added poly from the world.

*World - pointer to World used to add the poly.

*Poly - pointer to Poly to be removed.

Returns

geXform3D Functions

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_Copy(const geXForm3d *Src, geXForm3d *Dst);

Description

Copies the Src transform to the Dest transform.

Parameters

Src - Transform to copy from

Dest - Transform to copy to

Returns

void

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geXForm3d_IsValid(const geXForm3d *M);

Description

Determines if the transform is valid. This is a debugging API, primarily. It was designed to test for transforms that contained NAN values on Intel

machines, since it is easy to let NAN values slip into calculations. Since NANs do not generate hardware exceptions, it can be exceedingly difficult to determine

when data has gone bad.

Parameters

 

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE if M is 'valid'. 'Valid' means that M is non NULL, and there are no NAN's in the matrix.

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geXForm3d_IsOrthonormal( const geXForm3d *M);

Description

Determines if a transform is orthogonal (all basis vectors are perpendicular to each other, and are of length

1.0).

Parameters

Xform - Transform to test

Returns

returns GE_TRUE if M is orthonormal (if the rows and columns are all normalized (transform has no scaling or shearing) and is orthogonal (row1 cross row2 = row3 & col1 cross col2 = col3)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

This is a slow operation because of the need to calculate the length of the basis vectors, which requires 3 square

root operations. Note: * does not check for right-handed convention *

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI geBoolean GENESISCC geXForm3d_IsOrthogonal( const geXForm3d *M);

Description

Determines if a transform is orthogonal (all basis vectors are perpendicular to each other).

Parameters

Xform - Transform to test

Returns

Returns GE_TRUE if M is orthogonal (row1 cross row2 = row3 & col1 cross col2 = col3)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

Note: * does not check for right-handed convention *

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_Orthonormalize( geXForm3d *M);

Description

essentially removes scaling (or other distortions) from an orthogonal (or nearly orthogonal) matrix returns a right-handed matrix. Ensures that a transform's basis vectors are perpendicular to each other, and of length 1.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to orthonormalize

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

This operation essentially removes scaling and other distortions from a matrix. Because floating point error tends

to build through multiple matrix operations, it is normally a good idea for an application which stores transforms and accrues

operations into them to orthonormalize those matrices from time to time. The matrix library does not do this for you

automatically on every operation because the orthonormalization process is slow.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_SetIdentity(geXForm3d *M);

Description

sets M to an identity matrix (clears it). Builds the identity matrix

Parameters

Xform - Transform to build

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

The identity matrix is the transform, which when applied to another matrix or vector causes no change.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_SetXRotation( geXForm3d *M,geFloat RadianAngle);

Description

sets up a transform that rotates RadianAngle about X axis. All existing contents of M are replaced. Builds a transform that rotates about the X axis.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to build

Angle - Angle to rotate

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

Any existing contents in the transform are discarded. The translation component of the matrix is set to zero.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_SetYRotation( geXForm3d *M,geFloat RadianAngle);

Description

sets up a transform that rotates RadianAngle about Y axis all existing contents of M are replaced. Builds a transform that rotates about the Y axis.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to build

Angle - Angle to rotate

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

Any existing contents in the transform are discarded. The translation component of the matrix is set to zero.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_SetZRotation( geXForm3d *M,geFloat RadianAngle);

Description

sets up a transform that rotates RadianAngle about Z axis all existing contents of M are replaced. Builds a transform that rotates about the Z axis.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to build

Angle - Angle to rotate

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

Any existing contents in the transform are discarded. The translation component of the matrix is set to zero.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_SetTranslation( geXForm3d *M,geFloat x, geFloat y, geFloat z);

Description

Builds a transform that translates by X, Y and Z.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to build

X - X translation value

Y - Y translation value

Z - Z translation value

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

Any existing contents in the transform *M are discarded. The rotation component of the matrix is set to identity.

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_RotateX(geXForm3d *M,geFloat RadianAngle);

Description

Rotates M by RadianAngle about X axis applies the rotation to the existing contents of M. Rotates a transform about the X axis.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to apply the rotation to

Angle - Angle, in radians, to rotate the transform

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

The rotation is applied to the existing contents of the transform.

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_Translate(geXForm3d *M,geFloat x, geFloat y, geFloat z);

Description

Translates M by x,y,z applies the translation to the existing contents of M. Translates a transform by X, Y and Z.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to be translated

X - X displacement to apply to the translation of XForm.

Y - Y displacement to apply to the translation of XForm.

Z - Z displacement to apply to the translation of XForm.

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

The translation is applied to the existing contents of XForm, including the translation.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_Scale(geXForm3d *M,geFloat x, geFloat y, geFloat z);

Description

Scales M by x,y,z applies the scale to the existing contents of M. Scales a transform in all three axes.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to apply the scale factors to

X - Scale factor to apply to the X axis basis vector of the transform

Y - Scale factor to apply to the Y axis basis vector of the transform

Z - Scale factor to apply to the Z axis basis vector of the transform

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

The scaling is applied to the existing contents of the transform.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_Multiply(const geXForm3d *M1, const geXForm3d *M2, geXForm3d *MProduct);

Description

MProduct = matrix multiply of M1*M2. Calculates the product of M1 and M2. Concatenates the transformation in the M2 matrix onto the transformation in M1

Parameters

M1 - Input transform

M2 - Input transform

Product - Result of M1 * M2

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

The result is the concatentation of the transformat in M2 onto the transformation in M1.

Example

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_TransformArray(const geXForm3d XForm, const geVec3d *Source, geVec3d *Dest, int32 Count);

Description

Applies a transform to an array of vectors.

Parameters

Xform - Transform to apply

VectorArray - Array of vectors to apply the transform to

ResultArray - Transformed result array

Count - Number of vectors in the input array

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

It is assumed that there is enough space in the output array for the transformed results. This API is provided

primarily for efficiency.

Example

 

 

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_Rotate(const geXForm3d *M, const geVec3d *V, geVec3d *Result);

Description

Result is Matrix M * Vector V: V Rotated by M (no translation). Rotates a vector by a transform

Parameters

Xform - Rotation transform

Vector - Vector to be transformed

Result - Vector rotated by XForm (XForm * Vector)

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

Any translation component in the input transform is ignored.

Function

GENESISAPI void GENESISCC geXForm3d_GetLeft(const geXForm3d *M, geVec3d *Left);

Description

Gets a vector that is 'left' in the frame of reference of M (facing -Z). Gets the vector which, if applied to the translation of the matrix, would move the matrix a distance of 1.0 'left' along the current orientation of the matrix.

Parameters

Xform - Input transform

Left - Vector to store the direction in

Returns

Nothing (void)

Declared

Xform3d.h

Code

 

Remarks

 

Example

Gets a vector that is 'up' in the frame of reference of M (facing -Z). Gets the vector which, if applied to the translation of the matrix, would move the matrix a distance of 1.0 'up' along the current orientation of the matrix. See the overview for a more detailed discussion of In/Up/Left vectors for

matrices.

Up - Vector to store the direction in

Returns

matrices.

Up - Vector to store the direction in
